response: "Why does society expect me to be perfect? It's impossible to meet all these unrealistic standards."
"I feel so overwhelmed. It's like the world is constantly judging me and I can't escape it."
"I don't even know what is real anymore. Am I supposed to prioritize my own happiness or society's expectations?"
"I can't keep up with this constant pressure. It's driving me crazy trying to be someone I'm not."
"Everyone seems so put together, but I'm just falling apart trying to fit into their idea of perfection."
"I wish I could escape this never-ending cycle of comparison and self-doubt. It's so exhausting."
"I'm starting to question my own worth. If I can't meet society's standards, does that mean I'm a failure?"
"I feel like I'm losing myself in this quest for perfection. Who am I really, beyond what others expect?"
"It's like I'm trapped in a world where flaws are unacceptable. But isn't it our imperfections that make us human?"
"I just want to break free from this pressure and embrace my authentic self, without worrying about what others think."
